title: DENDROBIUM: Overview, Uses, Side Effects, Precautions, Interactions, Dosing and Reviews
description: Learn more about DENDROBIUM uses, effectiveness, possible side effects, interactions, dosage, user ratings and products that contain DENDROBIUM.
cleaned_text: Overview Traditionally, dendrobium plants have been used in Traditional Chinese medicine. Today, dendrobium is showing up in pre- [workout](https://www.webmd.com/fitness-exercise/ss/slideshow-7-most-effective-exercises) [supplements](https://www.webmd.com/men/video/lamm-supplements-diet)used to boost physical and athletic performance, but there is no good scientific evidence to support these uses. Some experts are still touting it as a replacement for the stimulant dimethylamylamine (DMAA). But at least one popular dendrobium-containing supplement (Craze, Driven Sports) has been identified by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) as being adulterated with a stimulant drug. How does it work ? [blood pressure](https://www.webmd.com/hypertension-high-blood-pressure/diastolic-and-systolic-blood-pressure-know-your-numbers), increase [blood sugar](https://www.webmd.com/diabetes/how-sugar-affects-diabetes), and reduce pain. They might also increase the chance of seizure. However, none of these effects have been studied in people. Therefore, the effects of dendrobium in people are not clear. Uses & Effectiveness Insufficient Evidence for - A type of [inflammatory bowel disease](https://www.webmd.com/ibd-crohns-disease/inflammatory-bowel-syndrome)(Crohn disease). - A type of inflammatory bowel disease ( [ulcerative colitis](https://www.webmd.com/ibd-crohns-disease/ulcerative-colitis/what-is-ulcerative-colitis)). - [gastritis](https://www.webmd.com/digestive-disorders/digestive-diseases-gastritis)). [Tuberculosis](https://www.webmd.com/lung/understanding-tuberculosis-basics). - Other conditions. Side Effects Special Precautions and Warnings [mouth](https://www.webmd.com/oral-health/ss/slideshow-mouth-problems): There isn't enough information to know if dendrobium is safe or what the side effects might be when taken by [mouth](https://www.webmd.com/oral-health/rm-quiz-mouth-myths). Pregnancy and [Breast](https://www.webmd.com/women/picture-of-the-breasts)-feeding: There isn't enough information to know if dendrobium is safe to take during pregnancy or breast-feeding. Stay on the safe side and avoid use. [Seizures](https://www.webmd.com/epilepsy/understanding-seizures-basics): There is a concern that dendrobium might increase the chance of seizure in some people. Dendrobium contains a chemical that might increase the chance of seizure. If you have ever had a seizure, don't use dendrobium. Interactions Medications used to prevent seizures (Anticonvulsants) interacts with DENDROBIUM Medications used to prevent seizures affect chemicals in the brain. Dendrobium might also affect chemicals in the brain in a way that might possibly decrease the effectiveness of medications used to prevent seizures. Some medications used to prevent seizures include others. Medications that increase the chance of having a seizure (Seizure threshold lowering drugs) interacts with DENDROBIUM Some medications increase the chance of having a seizure. Taking dendrobium might cause seizures in some people. If this combination is taken, it might increase the chance of having a seizure. Do not take dendrobium with medications that increase the chance of having a seizure. Some medications that increase the chance of having a seizure include anesthesia (propofol, stimulants (methylphenidate), theophylline, and others. Moderate Interaction Be cautious with this combination Medications for high blood pressure (Antihypertensive drugs) interacts with DENDROBIUM Dendrobium might decrease blood pressure. Taking dendrobium along with medications for high blood pressure might cause your blood pressure to go too low. Some medications for high blood pressure Interaction Be watchful with this combination Dosing [pharmacist](https://www.webmd.com/a-to-z-guides/features/pharmacists-they-do-more-than-fill-prescriptions)or physician or other [healthcare](https://www.webmd.com/health-insurance/rm-quiz-insurance-basics)professional before using. CONDITIONS OF USE AND IMPORTANT INFORMATION: This information is meant to supplement, not replace advice from your doctor or healthcare provider and is not meant to cover all possible uses, precautions, interactions or adverse effects. This information may not fit your specific health circumstances. Never delay or disregard seeking professional medical advice from your doctor or other qualified health care provider because of something you have read on WebMD. You should always speak with your doctor or health care professional before you start, stop, or change any prescribed part of your health care plan or treatment and to determine what course of therapy is right for you.
